title: Football news: Bernardo Silva's former club Benfica defends star over Mendy tweet
text:
Benfica have defended Bernardo Silva over his tweet that compared Benjamin Mendy to a cartoon used by Spanish company Conguitos.

The Manchester City forward has been hit with a misconduct charge by the FA over the tweet, and he has been given until October 9 to respond to it.

Silva could face a six-match ban if he is found guilty of the offence.

Bernardo Silva (right) has been charged by the FA with improper conduct after sending a racially insensitive tweet to team-mate Benjamin Mendy

The Portuguese midfielder faced angry backlash after posting this image on Twitter last month

But Benfica, where Silva began his career, released a statement on Friday that suggested the criticism was a sign of the times.

Their statement said: 'Bernardo Silva is a young man who always been distinguished for his simplicity, his character and his good upbringing.

'Wherever he goes, he is always missed and always ensures that the managers and team-mates who deal with him are unanimous in complimenting his happy and spontaneous nature. In Benfica, we are enormously proud of you, Bernardo!

'Turning a simple joke between two team-mates and friends into a tweet with racist intent and opening a misconduct charge demonstrates and signals a disease of our times.'

Pep Guardiola has repeatedly defended Silva's tweet but when asked about it on Friday he simply said: 'No comment anymore'.

The Frenchman took it well but Silva has since faced accusations of racism over the picture

Silva went on to delete the Tweet before expressing his frustration with the angry response
description: The Manchester City forward has been hit with a misconduct charge by the FA over the tweet, and he has been given until October 9 to respond to it. He could face a six-match ban.
